data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3447420,"name":"Ella","username":"ella.k","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/9e8a1a/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-11-14T07:18:15.598Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello— we have the OMIO CNC and recently got the tubestock fixture from \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eWCP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"West Coast Products\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e. I’d love to hear other teams’ processes for using the fixture to see how ours can improve. We want to make sure that we aren’t missing anything about the alignment that would make it more efficient or limit the need for exact accuracy when cutting tubestock on the chop saw. Any advice on strategies used to efficiently ensure accuracy in the tubestock alignment remaining consistent on both sides, or more generally with the tubestock extension would be appreciated. Thank you so
